intro: Lastrea alfredii, commonly known as the Alfred's lastrea, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, blooming during the cooler months. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is often found in coastal or arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
